hypothesis: L-BFGS-B achieved 1.1627 accuracy but took 202 min due to finite differences. Adjoint method computes gradients in O(1) forward + O(1) adjoint solve, enabling gradient-based optimization within budget.

tuning_runs.notes: FAILURE - Score 0.9006 is 20% worse than baseline 1.1247. RMSE 0.5737 is 3-4x worse than baseline ~0.15. Most L-BFGS-B runs show 0 iterations - gradient appears inaccurate.

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - Adjoint gradient is 5-6 orders of magnitude smaller than finite differences
tuning_runs.notes: Implementation is fundamentally incorrect. The adjoint PDE solver or gradient computation has errors.

final_result: FAILED - Adjoint gradient implementation is incorrect. Gradients are 5-6 orders of magnitude too small, causing L-BFGS-B to not iterate. Manual adjoint derivation is error-prone for complex PDEs with ADI time-stepping.
